name: Challenge the Darkness
description:
Use [Arrow Keys and Enter] or [Swipe and Tap] to play

When the sun was setting for the first time, people started to panic. They didn't know what was happening. Darkness started to put it's feet all over the Earth. People were resigned to living in darkness forever...

This is a visualisation of a short story recited  by Jaswant Singh Khalra. 

Jaswant Singh Khalra was a prominent Human rights activist who uncovered illegal mass killings and cremations of Sikhs in Panjab, India.

Jaswant Singh Khalra estimated that there could have been over 25,000 Sikhs illegally killed and cremated by the state during 1980's and 1990's.

On 6 September 1995, Jaswant Singh Khalra was abducted and murdered by Punjab Police
